New Records: Nikola Jokic and Russell Westbrook are the first pair of teammates to record 25-point triple-doubles in the same regular-season game in NBA history.
Key Match Events: Nikola Jokic recorded a triple-double with 35 points, 12 rebounds, 15 assists, and four steals.
Russell Westbrook recorded a triple-double with 25 points, 11 rebounds, and 10 assists.
Brooklyn led 20-12 five minutes into the game.
The score was 97-92 early in the fourth quarter before the Nuggets pulled away.
Julian Strawther and Peyton Watson scored in double figures off the bench.
Keon Johnson led the Nets with 22 points.
Tyrese Martin added 19 points off the bench for the Nets.
Pre-Game Insights: Michael Malone expressed concerns about playing against a short-handed Brooklyn Nets team.
Nikola Jokic returned to the lineup after two games of sick leave.
Aaron Gordon was upgraded to doubtful before the game but remained out with a calf strain.
Post-Match Reflections: Michael Malone commented on the historical significance of Jokic and Westbrook's performance.
Russell Westbrook praised Jokic for making the game easy for everyone.
Michael Malone reflected on the challenge of playing against a team with many injured players.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Nuggets got to the line for 33 free throw attempts in the win.
Denver lost Jokic’s rest minutes by 14 points after playing two impressive games without him this week.
Jamal Murray felt soreness in his left knee and didn’t return.
